CatDescriptText: Text with image published in advertisement in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1953, pg. 19, reads: "The Day You Have Been Waiting For Is Now Here, Grand Opening Monday, August 31, of the Newly Remodeled Crawford Grill No. 2, Wylie Avenue At Elmore Street. Everything Is New...New, Comfortable Plastic Booths in Chartreuse and Pumpkin Red...New Modernistic Murals on the Walls...New Chinaware, All Tending to Give a Cozy Atmosphere...Designed to Make Your Eating and Drinking a Pleasure...Try Our Delicious Steak and Chicken Dinners.  Our Bartenders Can Mix Any Drink You Desire.  Hear LeRoy Brown and his Brown Buddies Every Evening..."
TitMainTitle: Band with Bobby Anderson on drums, George "Duke" Spaulding on piano, Bill "Bass" McMahon on bass, and Leroy Brown on saxophone standing on stage, with audience looking on from below, at Crawford Grill No. 2
